primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God invades the realm of Death and Doubt to reclaim humanity from the 'Night' and restore them to life through His self-revelation.

tekstueel_bewijs: He arose from the kingdom of Death and carried away its spoils.
The risen, living, reigning Christ says to us today...
God has entered our pain and been wounded by it... yet has been raised triumphant.
receive the gift of eternal light and life in his name
grant his divine life to all who come to him

zender.identificatie: God the Father / The Living Word
tekstueel_bewijs: the light of the incarnate Word of God comes to shine
the living Word of God, which is unique and trustworthy
opened unto us the gate of everlasting life
Thomas stands for all of us here
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: Does hearer identify with Subject or Receiver?

helper.identificatie: The Holy Spirit / The Word / The Wounds of Christ
tekstueel_bewijs: through the Word of God the Holy Spirit creates such faith
the sight of his wounds, and his word are enough
the night in which Sin and Death reign
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not merely bad habits but ontological powers (Death, Satan) that require a divine Subject to overcome.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human response of faith and confession following the divine act.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer (Mary, Thomas, Job)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The human response is a result of the divine initiative; faith is 'created' by the Word, not generated by the Subject.

voorbeelden_god_subject: He arose from the kingdom of Death.
The Holy Spirit creates such faith.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: Mary Magdalene came to the tomb.
We can choose a god who suits us.

voorbeelden: faith must stand... in the place of ambiguity
Job’s great longing is for revelation.
they did not know the scripture
having power to grant his divine life
overcame death and opened unto us the gate

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on God's 'ability' (Pouvoir) to do what man cannot (overcome death), rather than man's 'obligation' (Devoir).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S2 (Night) to ~S2 (Human Solace) to ~S1 (Doubt) and finally to S1 (Resurrection Life).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by the 'Who' (Christ) invading the 'Why' (Suffering).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; Death is described as a 'cold clasp' and 'merciless'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is strictly theocentric. God is the primary actor; human faith is a gift/effect of the Word, and the opponent is a cosmic power only God can defeat.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: None found; even doubt is met with gracious appearance.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Subject of Active Verbs
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: He arose from the kingdom of Death and carried away its spoils.
The night in which Sin and Death reign.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Thomas and Job are not models of 'how to have faith,' but examples of human incompetence met by divine revelation.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides a theocentric reading: God reveals Himself to the doubter.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and comfort; the burden of 'achieving' faith is removed.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'Night' of John to the 'Whirlwind' of Job is perfectly integrated through the theme of divine self-revelation.
spanning_punten: The tension between human 'why' and divine 'who'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: He arose from the kingdom of Death and carried away its spoils.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit 'creates' faith and 'raises' us from the death of sin.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is linked to Death and the 'Power of Darkness,' making it an inescapable state for humans.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon maintains a consistent theocentric structure where God is the Subject and humanity is the Receiver.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is appropriate for Easter.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in Rutledge's 'Grammar of Grace.' It avoids the trap of turning Thomas or Job into moral examples, focusing instead on the God who answers them.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'Night' metaphor, Greimas shows that 'Night' functions as a cosmic Opponent actant.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Greek/Hebrew; semiotics explains why the story 'works' to provide comfort by switching the Subject from the grieving human to the rising Christ.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that faith is not a human 'work' but a modal competence (Pouvoir) granted by the Sender (God) via the Helper (The Word).

appendices.notities: The sermon consistently treats faith as a passive reception of a divine act.
